intro: Turraea, commonly known as the African snowball or white thorn, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It comprises several species, many of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plants are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered yellow or white flowers. They often have thorny stems and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Some species of Turraea are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
